text: John Douglas Edwards (26 February 1931 – 23 August 2014) was an Australian rules footballer who played with North Melbourne in the Victorian Football League (VFL) during the 1950s. Edwards was a fullback and won a Syd Barker Medal in 1956 for North Melbourne's best and fairest player. He also represented Victoria at interstate football towards the end of his career. After retiring as a player he became a coach in the VFA for both Coburg and Brunswick. He remained involved in the game as well as a football commentator on TV. ==References== ==External links== * *Jack Edwards at Australian Football.com Category:1931 births Category:Australian rules footballers from Victoria (Australia) Category:North Melbourne Football Club players Category:Coburg Football Club coaches Category:Syd Barker Medal winners Category:2014 deaths
title: Jack Edwards (Australian footballer, born 1931)
